sub_title: Chemist | Scientist | Teacher | NMR | Polymers | Self-assembly | Synthesis | Catalysis
summary:
Enthusiastic Chemistry PhD with extensive experience in polymer chemistry. Skilled in polymer, organic and systems chemistry, nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) and management. I am eager to learn, and seek to work my way into new subjects. Giving up is not an option, I will continue until the goal is reached.

Because I enjoy managing a team, I have trained and supervised over 17 students during my PhD. I indicate not only what needs to be done, but also how it can be done, and dare to leave things to them so they grow more confident. Bringing new ideas and proposals forward decisively and with enthusiasm allows me to pursue my lines of research. 

My goal is to innovate, inspire, and deliver. 

Polymer Chemistry | NMR | Guiding a Team | Sustainability

P.B. White and dr. J. Mecinovic (Synthetic Organic Chemistry).
-	Monitored reaction time-courses via in situ and ex situ quantitative 1H and 31P NMR to determine rate constants for consumption of azide, intermediate growth and decay, and amide formation.
-	Synthesised key intermediates that play a role in and outside the catalytic cycle, and observed their step-wise reactivity to better understand the role of each reagent and intermediate in the cycle.
-	Applied multinuclear 1H, 13C, 29Si and 31P 2D NMR techniques to determine the structure of intermediates formed during the catalytic cycle.
-	Investigated monomer-dimer speciation via diffusion-ordered spectroscopy (DOSY NMR) and exchange spectroscopy (EXSY NMR).', 'title': 'Master Internship NMR Mechanistic Studies', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'Nijmegen en omgeving, Nederland', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'company': 'Radboud University', 'description': '- Practical courses: Organic Chemistry (years 1 and 2), Thermodynamics, Metal-organic Chemistry.

- Lecturer: HBO premaster students for Thermodynamics 1&2.
- Judge and assistant: European Union Science Olympiad and Chemistry Olympiad.', 'title': 'Laboratory course and exercise class assistant ', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'company': 'Radboud University', 'description': 'Synthesising organic molecular scaffold molecules as part of the drug discovery European Lead Factory project in collaboration with MercaChem;  supervised by prof. dr. F.P.J.T. Rutjes and dr. D. Blanco Ania (Synthetic Organic Chemistry).
-	Advanced the total synthesis of three different scaffold molecules, requiring thorough multistep reaction optimization and development of alternative pathways to the target molecule.
-	Acquired new skills including photochemical reactions, Schlenk technique and Flow Chemistry into my repertoire as a synthetic organic chemist.
-	Designed several synthetic routes towards novel scaffolds of interest to the ELF project.
-	Collaborated effectively with Mercachem to optimise reactions for multigram scale chemistry.', 'title': 'Master Internship Synthetic Organic Chemistry', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': None, 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'company': 'Radboud University', 'description': 'Evaluation and assessment of courses in the chemistry curriculum.
